name: SEER Regional Nodes
title: SEER Regional Nodes
description: I would  delete last sentence in note 1 (unless definitions are provided  in a particular section of SS16 then it should refer to that reference), possibility note 2 and note5 should be deleted as well. I would keep the rest. For code 300 in the table, I would keep the LN level numbers documentation from CS.
notes:
**Note 1:**  For head and neck schemas, this field includes all lymph nodes defined as Levels I-VII and Other by AJCC.  (The complete definitions are provided in the General Rules, Section 2.--delete)

**Note 2:**  For head and neck schemas, additional information about lymph nodes (size of involved nodes, extracapsular extension, levels involved, and location of involved nodes above or below the lower border of the cricoid cartilage) is coded in CS Site-Specific Factors 1, 3-9. (delete--unless these are part of the SSFs that will continue to be collected)

**Note 3:**  For head and neck cancers, if lymph nodes are described only as "supraclavicular", try to determine if they are in Level IV (deep to the sternocleidomastoid muscle, in the lower jugular chain) or Level V (in the posterior triangle, inferior to the transverse cervical artery) and code appropriately.  If the specific level cannot be determined, consider them as Level V nodes. [SUGGESTED ADDITION--Only LEVEL IV nodes are coded as regional; Level V nodes are considered DISTANT and should be coded under "SEER Mets."]

**Note 4:**  The description of lymph nodes has been standardized across the head and neck schemas.  All lymph node levels and groups listed here are considered regional nodes for AJCC staging.  Summary Stage 1977 and Summary Stage 2000 divide these nodes into regional and distant groups.

**Note 5:**  Facial nodes including mandibular nodes have been moved from code 100 in CS Version 1 to code 110. (delete)
